Filling small holes in walls - Toothpaste can be used as a quick fix for small holes in walls.
Polishing silver - Apply toothpaste to silver items and then wipe off for a quick shine.
Removing scuff marks from shoes - Rub toothpaste onto scuff marks on shoes and wipe off with a damp cloth.
Getting rid of pimples - Apply a small amount of toothpaste to pimples to help dry them out.
Cleaning jewelry - Use toothpaste to gently polish and clean jewelry.
Defogging goggles - Rub a small amount of toothpaste onto the inside of goggles and wipe off for a fog-free swim or dive.
Whitening piano keys - Gently clean and whiten piano keys with a small amount of toothpaste.
Soothing bug bites - Apply a small amount of toothpaste to bug bites to help reduce itching and swelling.
Removing crayon marks from walls - Use toothpaste to help remove crayon marks from walls.
Freshening up sneakers - Apply toothpaste to the insides of sneakers to help remove odors.
Towel art: Use towels to create stunning origami or towel folding art to display in your bathroom or as part of a themed party décor.
Towel wall mural: Arrange colorful towels to create a large-scale mural or design on a blank wall.
Towel poncho: Transform a large towel into a makeshift poncho for impromptu beach or pool cover-up.
Towel tablecloth: Use a towel as a tablecloth for a casual and colorful outdoor picnic or indoor gathering.
Towel pet bed: Fold and stack towels to create a cozy cushion for your furry friend's bed or crate.
Towel curtains: Hang towels as curtains for a fun and quirky window treatment in a beach house or bathroom.
Towel gardening: Use old towels as a weed barrier in your vegetable or flower garden to help control and suppress unwanted growth.
Towel gym equipment padding: Use towels to pad and cushion equipment for gymnastics or home exercise routines.
Towel car seat cover: Use towels to protect your car seats from sweat, mud, or pet hair after outdoor activities.
Towel fashion: Get creative and use towels to create unique fashion pieces like a beach towel wrap skirt or a towel turban for a spa day at home.
Vase as a fruit bowl - Use a wide vase to display and hold an assortment of colorful fruits for a unique and decorative centerpiece.
Vase as a fish bowl - Create a mini underwater world by turning a vase into a fishbowl for a small, low-maintenance pet.

Vase as a terrarium - Create a mini garden inside a clear glass vase with soil, small plants, and decorative stones for a beautiful and low-maintenance indoor garden.

Vase as a wine cooler - Fill a large, wide-mouthed vase with ice and water to keep a bottle of wine or champagne chilled during a party or special occasion.
Vase as a makeup brush holder - Use a small, decorative vase to store and display makeup brushes and other beauty tools on a vanity or bathroom counter.
Vase as a bird feeder - Turn a large vase on its side and fill it with birdseed for a unique and eye-catching bird feeder in the garden or on a balcony.
Vase as a plant stand - Turn a vase upside down to create a simple and stylish platform for elevating potted plants or small sculptures.
Vase as a table lamp base - Convert a vase into a customized table lamp by adding a lamp kit and shade for a one-of-a-kind lighting fixture.
